moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 e:
More common*: 5. Nb5 d6,
Even 5. Nxc6 bxc6, is seen more often.
*according to the Gameknot database.
moves.5... Nf6 6. Bd3: 6. Nc3 would have been better, while this protects the pawn, develops the bishop, and prepares to castle, it also loses the central d5 square, which had previously been protected by the queen. 6. Nc3 would still have protected the pawn, as well as controlling d5.
moves.6... d5 7. exd5 Nxd5: Taking with the queen would have been better here, as it would have prevented 8. Bb5
I should have played 17. ... Ba6 , instead I waited two moves, I guess that I didn't see that it would force white to sacrifice the rook.
moves.20. Rd3 Bxd3+ 21. cxd3 Re7 22. Nf5 Ree8:
Can you see how I force three pawns?
(Hint: they are the f, d, and c pawns).
moves.29... Bxc5 30. Bxc5: Perhaps 30. Bd2 would have been better, so that white would only lose one pawn.
White should never have traded rooks, now I am far enough ahead that I can't possibly lose.
moves.34... Rxd5 35. a3 a4 36. Kf2 Rd2+ 37. Kf: White's final mistake, that move made my job so much easier.
